definition: to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The whole show at one go, the magnificent atmosphere, shocking the audience.
sentences.chinese: 整場演出一氣呵成，恢宏大氣，震撼全場。

sentences.english: With good preparations, he got his graduation thesis done at one go.
sentences.chinese: 由於前期準備充分，他的畢業論文一氣呵成。

sentences.english: Many differences, can't do things in one take.
sentences.chinese: 做事多有分歧，不能一氣呵成。

sentences.english: You can install a huge number of popular software at one go with this tool.
sentences.chinese: 用了它你可以一氣呵成地下載浩如煙海的流行軟件。

sentences.english: Three processes in the same pot at one go.
sentences.chinese: 三個工序在同一鍋內一氣呵成。

sentences.english: Straight ahead usually requires more pre-planning.
sentences.chinese: 一氣呵成的方法可能更要求有好的規劃。

sentences.english: It is so wonderful that I wanner to read the next one immediately!
sentences.chinese: 它是如此的精彩，以至於我立即讀下去，一氣呵成。

sentences.english: No weighing, along with the gender of freedom in one take, became the appearance.
sentences.chinese: 沒有稱量，自由隨性的一氣呵成，就成了上圖的模樣。

definition: to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
to blend into one another/to blend together well
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
sense of movement (often in a static work of art)/dynamic/vivid/lifelike
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
